articles.title: Playmobil sends ESA astronauts on 'Mars Expedition' with new toy set - Space.com
articles.description: Two European Space Agency (ESA) astronauts are set to begin exploring Mars after they land on toy store shelves. Playmobil, in cooperation with ESA, is set to release its new Mars Expedition playset.
articles.content:

articles.title: Royal flush! Aussie wealth group Crestone snapped up in $475m deal - The Australian Financial Review
articles.description: Australia’s Crestone Wealth Management, a financial advice and portfolio management firm servicing wealthy clients and family offices, is set to be snapped up by a global private banking group backed by a European royal family.
articles.content: Crestone has since grown to have about 90 advisers and 250 employees nationally, and retained some ties to UBS. Its regarded in Australias wealth industry as one of the biggest providers of advice to… [+904 chars]

articles.title: Milky Way: Astronomers capture the deepest and sharpest images to date of our galaxy's black hole - Daily Mail
articles.description: Stunning new images released by the European Southern Observatory (ESO), show several stars moving around their orbit of the Milky Way's black hole, called Sagittarius A*.
articles.content:

articles.title: Xiaomi Watch S1 to launch within the next few months, launches scheduled in Europe and Asia Pacific countries - Notebookcheck.net
articles.description: Reportedly, Xiaomi has settled on releasing the Watch S1 before April 2022. The smartwatch does away with Xiaomi's 'Mi' branding and will be available across Europe and Asia Pacific countries.
